full_card_text: Web Development Intern |  | Avadhuta Technologies |  | Bangalore | Competitive stipend | 6 Months | Company DescriptionAvadhuta Technologies is a Product Engineering & SaaS Development Studio focused on delivering scalable, high-quality digital products for startups and small to medium-sized businesses (SMBs). Additionally, the intern will engage with team members to gather project requirements and ensure seamless execution of development tasks aligned with business objectives.QualificationsProficiency in Front-End Development and Web Design, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScriptStrong understanding of Web Development fundamentals with hands-on experience or project workExcellent Communication skills with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environmentKnowledge of responsive design principles and modern web frameworks is a plusFamiliarity with basic DevOps processes and version control systems (e.g., Git) is an advantageFamiliarity with Wordpress and PHP programming is an advantageAn ability to learn quickly, demonstrate strong problem-solving skills, and adapt to dynamic project requirementsCompensationStipend: Rs. 5000 to Rs. 7000 PM Full time employment opportunity post internship, based on performance. | Today | Be an early applicant

title: Unknown Title
full_card_text: Intern - HSEQ |  | SmartQ |  | Bangalore | Competitive stipend | 6 Months | About SmartQSmartQ is redefining how the world experiences food. As a next-generation food-tech innovator, we solve real operational challenges through empathy-led insights and powerful technology. Our mission is clear: to elevate everyday dining into a seamless and meaningful experience.In the last decade, weve transformed cafeteria and food operations across industries with scalable, cutting-edge solutions. Operating in 14 countries and backed by Compass Group- a $60B global foodservice leader SmartQ continues to push the boundaries of what modern food-tech can achieve.Since our inception in 2015, weve become a trusted partner for corporates, hospitals, universities, and food courts worldwide. With a bold vision to become the worlds largest B2B food-tech company, we connect people through exceptional food experiences powered by advanced technology. Today, we proudly serve 400+ global clients, including leaders like Google, HSBC, Amazon, and Wells Fargo.At the heart of SmartQ is a culture shaped by four core pillars:Great People | Great Food | Great Experience | Greater GoodThese values inspire collaboration, innovation, humility, and a relentless pursuit of excellence.To dive deeper into what drives us, explore our cultural pillars on the SmartQ LinkedIn Life page. It offers an authentic glimpse into the journey you could be part of: https://www.linkedin.com/company/smartq-bottlelabs/life/cdc290f8-ff81-4e7f-9c96-37d842f936c4/?viewAAre you excited to join our team as Intern - HSEQ?The HSEQ Intern will support the HSEQ team in implementing and monitoring Health, Safety, Environment, and Quality standards across cafeteria and kitchen operations. This role provides hands-on exposure to food safety, workplace safety, audits, and compliance activities within the food and hospitality environment.If you are passionate about food safety and workplace well-being and eager to make a meaningful impact, we invite you to join SmartQ.Key responsibilitiesThe intern will support and oversee HSEQ activities at assigned sites during the internship period, ensuring adherence to safety, quality, and compliance standards.Support HSEQ inspections by collecting data, documenting observations, and tracking corrective actions.Assist in preparing snag reports for base kitchens and cafeteria counters in coordination with operations teams.Support the development and coordination of HSEQ training materials and awareness programs for site staff.Help ensure compliance with food safety, hygiene, equipment safety, and statutory requirements.Collect and analyze employee and client feedback to support continuous improvement initiatives.Assist in incident, accident, and near-miss investigations, including documentation of RCA and CAPA under supervision.Maintain HSEQ records, reports, and compliance documentation.QualificationBachelors degree or currently pursuing a degree in Food Science, Environmental Science, Occupational Safety, or a related field.Graduates seeking for internship exposure in HSEQ / food safety are encouraged to apply.Basic knowledge of food safety standards such as HACCP and ISO 22000 is an added advantage.Awareness of workplace safety and hygiene practices.Good communication and interpersonal skills.Willingness to learn, proactive, and detail oriented.Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.Message from CEO:We've come to realize that we're not merely in the B2B Food service industry; we're in the business of 'Capturing Hearts.' We find ourselves in a unique position to turn ordinary, mundane corporate cafeterias into places of pure delight, where individuals can freely express themselves, find inspiration, and share happiness. Such a profound transformation opportunity is a rare gift, where the purpose of our enterprise transcends the ordinary. If this vision resonates with you, we invite you to join us in our mission to spread joy and happiness in a world weighed down by stress and pressure. Together, let's play our part in making this world a more beautiful place. | Today | Be an early applicant
